name: Introduction to Linguistics
description: A survey course that introduces students to basic concepts in linguistics, including the study of language, its structure, and its functions.

name: Syntax and Morphology
description: An in-depth look at the structure of language, including the analysis of sentence construction, word formation, and the application of linguistic rules.

name: Phonetics and Phonology
description: A course that examines the production and perception of speech sounds, and explores the ways in which these sounds interact with each other.

name: Semantics and Pragmatics
description: A course that introduces students to the study of meaning in language, and examines how language is used in different contexts.

name: Applied Linguistics
description: A course that explores the application of linguistic theory to real-world problems, such as teaching and language acquisition.
